item.title: I&IC at Renewable Futures Conference in Riga | #thinking #speculation #futures - fabric | rblg
item.description:
I&IC at Renewable Futures Conference in Riga | #thinking #speculation #futures - fabric | rblg

Inhabiting and Interfacing the Cloud(s)will be presented during the peer reviewed Renewable Futures Conferencenext week in Riga (Estonia), which will be the first edition of a serie that promiss to scout for radical approaches.

item.title: Datadroppers, a new (old) tool or the project of a data commune | #data #commune #service - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Datadroppers, a new (old) tool or the project of a data commune | #data #commune #service - fabric | rblg

It is a data commune, but not a "community". It is from a "market product" point of view "unsocial", almost uninteresting to later commodify.

item.title: I&IC within Poetics and Politics of Data, exhibition at H3K, scenography. Pictures | #data #research - fabric | rblg
item.description:
I&IC within Poetics and Politics of Data, exhibition at H3K, scenography. Pictures | #data #research - fabric | rblg

Note: last end of May was the opening of the exhibition Poetics & Politics of Data at the Haus der elektronischen Künste in Basel. This was the occasion to present the temporary results of the design research I'm leading at ECAL/University of Art & Design Lausanne , in collaboration with Nicolas Nova from HEAD - Genève , EPFL and EPFL-ECAL Lab .

item.title: Poetics and Politics of Data | #exhibition #data #research - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Poetics and Politics of Data | #exhibition #data #research - fabric | rblg

The exhibition „Poetics and Politics of Data" addresses the paradigm of a data-driven society and reflects life in an increasingly datified world. In visionary future scenarios, scientists enthuse over a world in which algorithms take over managing processes, envisioning a highly sensory and datafied space for us to live in, a world in which our desires and activities are anticipated, long before we carry them out.

item.title: Deterritorialized House - Inhabiting the data center, 2014 sketches... | #data #decenter #housing - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Deterritorialized House - Inhabiting the data center, 2014 sketches... | #data #decenter #housing - fabric | rblg

What is happening when you combine a fully deterritorialized program (super or hyper-modern, "non lieu", ...) with the one of the home? What might it say or comment about contemporary living?

item.title: Inhabiting and Interfacing the Cloud(s) - Talk & workshop at LIFT 15 - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Inhabiting and Interfacing the Cloud(s) - Talk & workshop at LIFT 15 - fabric | rblg

Note: Following my recent posts about the research project "Inhabiting & Intercacing the Cloud(s)" I'm leading for ECAL, Nicolas Nova and I will be present during next Lift Conference in Geneva (Feb. 4-6 2015) for a talk combined with a workshop and a skype session with EPFL (a workshop related to the I&IC research project will be on the finish line at EPFL -Prof.

item.title: Etapes issue 221: Médias & design graphique | #deterritorialized - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Etapes issue 221: Médias & design graphique | #deterritorialized - fabric | rblg

Note: w e didn't found enough time last December to document an interview of fabric | ch that was publish in the French design magazine Étapes. So let's do it in early 2015... The magazine itself has been recently revamped under the direction of a new editorial board.

item.title: Design research: I&IC - Inhabiting & Interfacing the Clouds | #datacenter #cloud #infrastructure - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Design research: I&IC - Inhabiting & Interfacing the Clouds | #datacenter #cloud #infrastructure - fabric | rblg

I'm very happy to write that after several months of preparation, I'm leading a new design-research (that follows Variable Environment, dating back from 2007!) for the University of Art & design, Lausanne (ECAL), in partnership with Nicolas Nova (HEAD).

item.title: Desierto Issue #3 - 28° Celsius is out! Deterritorialized Living included | #atmosphere - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Desierto Issue #3 - 28° Celsius is out! Deterritorialized Living included | #atmosphere - fabric | rblg

28° Celsius is the temperature at which protection becomes superfluous. It is also the temperature at which swimming pools are acclimatised. Within the limits of the this hygrothermal comfort zone, we do not require the intervention of our body's thermoregulatory mechanisms nor that of any external artificial thermal controls in order to feel pleasantly comfortable while carrying out a sedentary activity without clothing.

item.title: Back from Summer | #backindeed - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Back from Summer | #backindeed - fabric | rblg

We've been working on a new publication for the magazine PAPER / Architectural Histamine about the project Deterritorialized Living, that has just been published, an interview for ETAPES: design & cultures visuelles magazine and we've also been invited to work on two competitions (invitations & deadlines during deep Summer are always most welcome...).
